duck: Arc length - Determining the length of an irregular arc segment is also called rectification of a curve.
Geminate consonant - In phonetics, gemination happens when a spoken consonant is pronounced for an audibly longer period of time than a short consonant.
length definition: the longer or longest dimension of an object.
Length of a polynomial - In mathematics, the height and length of a polynomial P with complex coefficients are measures of its "size".
Length of a module, in abstract algebra
Length in its basic meaning is the long dimension of an object.
Vowel length - In linguistics, vowel length is the perceived duration of a vowel sound.

wiki.text:
In geometric measurements, 'length' is the longest dimension of an
object.<ref>[http://wordnetweb.princeton.edu/perl/webwn?s=length
Princeton.edu]</ref> In other contexts "length" is the measured dimension of an
object. For example it is possible to cut a length of a wire which is shorter
than wire thickness.

Length may be distinguished from height, which is vertical extent, and width or
breadth, which are the distance from side to side, measuring across the object
at right angles to the length. Length is a measure of one dimension, whereas
area is a measure of two dimensions (length squared) and volume is a measure of
three dimensions (length cubed). In most systems of measurement, the unit of
length is a fundamental unit, from which other units are defined.

 length of one kilometre is equivalent to the imperial measurement of
 0.62137 miles.]]
wiki.title: length
